snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday’s selections include the use of voice over Internet protocol telephones to make denial of service attacks on other phones, and the...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday’s selections include the use of voice over Internet protocol telephones to make denial of service attacks on other phones, and the huge amounts of money Microsoft and Google invest in data centers.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Internet Phone Attacks, and Data Center Dollars
